data.title: 220 Good Baby Middle Names for Boys & Girls
data.meta_description: From cute boy middle names to cool ones for girls, and weird ones in between, good middle names come from surprising places!
data.text:
Looking to take babyâ€™s name up a level? From cute boy middle names to cool ones for girls (and weird ones in between), good baby middle names come from surprising places!

Ah, the middle name â€“ the most neglected and misunderstood of titles.

Most are left on the sidelines, called on only for airplane tickets, official documents, or when mama is no longer messing around.

And those kept in the center are often shortened to a mysterious initial.

But if chosen well, middle names add a certain gravitas. âœ¨

They can be a beautiful tribute to a beloved friend or a way of honoring both parents.

And the best part is theyâ€™re totally optional for the bearer to use and adapt.

You can drop it, shorten it, or turn it into an endearing nickname â€“ whatâ€™s not to love?

Weâ€™re celebrating the return of the middle moniker with 220 suggestions for good middle names for boys and girls.

And while we can give you ideas, ultimately the choice is yours!

In this article: ğŸ“

Do middle names matter?

Once upon a time (in the West anyway), middle names werenâ€™t so common.

George Washington was just George Washington.

Mary Wollstonecraft was just Mary Wollstonecraft.

But then, sometime in the 19th century, everything changed, and you ended up with Pablo Diego JosÃ© Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno MarÃ­a de los Remedios Cipriano de la SantÃ­sima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso (or Picasso, as he was better known).

So why do middle names exist exactly?

It all started in Ancient Rome, where boys would be given three names â€“ a personal name, a family name, and a cognomen for the branch of the family they were from.

The more names you had, the higher your social status was (so feel free to get generous with your middle names).

But itâ€™s not all about the boysâ€™ middle names.

The tradition of Western middle names is rooted in the Medieval era when parents couldnâ€™t decide between the family name or a saint name.

Baptismal names became the easy solution and the tradition was born.

And while many cultures no longer have middle names, plenty of other cultures still do.

From Latin America to Russia, there are so many traditions you can lean into when choosing a middle name.

Too much choice?

Donâ€™t worry, weâ€™ve narrowed it down and categorized to help you find the one.

What is a great middle name?

If you donâ€™t feel bound to any one middle name tradition, you may be wondering how you want to approach picking one.

Asking these questions could help:

Do you want to honor someone? You can use a middle name to recognize a beloved relation, ancestor, or friend. A recent study found that most parents choose middle names as a commemoration. But itâ€™s up to you.

Do you want to celebrate your heritage? A middle name can be a good way to acknowledge the place you or your family are from.

Do you want to try something different? If youâ€™d like to try a name thatâ€™s a bit more unusual, but donâ€™t want to use it every day, it can work well as a middle name.

Canâ€™t agree? Arguing over different names? You wouldnâ€™t be the first. Making use of middle names can be an excellent compromise.

Is one enough? With middle names, the skyâ€™s the limit. If you feel that two or three middle names flow better than one, go for it.

How do the names fit together? If you have a middle name in mind, play around with it before you commit. Write the full name down, repeat it out loud, and pay attention to the initials. This way youâ€™ll notice anything awkward before itâ€™s too late.

What are good middle names for boys?

So, what are some cool middle names?

With this question in mind, letâ€™s take a look at some good middle names for boys and girls.

While weâ€™ve divided them up by gender, thereâ€™s no rule to say you have to stick to these conventions!

First names to use as middle names for boys

But if a classic isnâ€™t your style, a great place to look for middle name inspiration is a list of popular first names.

Here are some to start with (and check out Peanutâ€™s big list of boy names for more):

Liam: Meaning â€œhelmet of willâ€.

Fred: Meaning â€œpeaceful rulerâ€. âœŒï¸

Noah: Meaning â€œrestâ€ or â€œreposeâ€.

Oliver: Meaning â€œolive treeâ€. ğŸ«’

Elijah: Meaning â€œYahweh is my Godâ€.

Benjamin: A biblical name meaning â€œson of my right handâ€.

Lucas: Meaning â€œbringer of lightâ€.

Henry: A regal middle name from the Old German Haimirich meaning â€œhome rulerâ€.

Mason: From the Old French word masson meaning â€œstone-workerâ€.

Gilles: Meaning â€œservant of Jesusâ€.

Ethan: Of Hebrew origin, Ethan is a strong middle name that means â€œfirmâ€, â€œenduringâ€, and long-livedâ€.

Jacob: Meaning â€œsupplanterâ€, Jacob is an interesting pick for a middle name.

Logan: This Scottish name means â€œlittle hollowâ€.

Jackson: Meaning â€œson of Jackâ€, this Old English middle name is a great pick if you want to honor your partner.

Sebastian: Meaning â€œvenerableâ€ or â€œreveredâ€.

Jack: Meaning â€œGod is graciousâ€.

Owen: A Welsh name meaning â€œwell-bornâ€ or â€œyoung warriorâ€.

Theodore: Meaning â€œgift of Godâ€.

Aiden: An Irish name meaning â€œlittle fireâ€.

Samuel: Meaning â€œGod has heardâ€.

Matthew: Meaning â€œgift of Godâ€.

Luke: A popular short form of the Latin Lucas meaning â€œbringer of lightâ€.

Carter: Meaning â€œtransporter of goods by cartâ€.

Julian: A Greek gender-neutral middle name meaning â€œyouthfulâ€.

Grayson: This distinguishing middle name means â€œson of a stewardâ€. Anyone else getting major Game of Thrones vibes?

Jayden: Meaning â€œthankfulâ€. ğŸ™

Gabriel: Inspired by a certain archangel, Gabriel means â€œGod is my strengthâ€.

Lincoln: Meaning â€œlake colonyâ€, Lincoln is one of the more widely recognized boy middle names. A little seed of inspiration for baby perhaps?

What are cute boy middle names?

Feel like one cute name is just not enough to capture your sentiments for your lovable baby boy?

Weâ€™ve got you:

Levi: Named for the son of Jacob and Leah in the Old Testament, Levi means â€œjoined in harmonyâ€. As cute boy middle names go, this one is a clear winner if you happen to share the parentâ€™s names. What are the chances?

Asher: A cute Jewish name meaning â€œhappinessâ€.

Myles: Meaning â€œsoldierâ€ Milo is an adorable alternative.

Mateo: The Spanish form of Matthew meaning â€œgift from Godâ€.

Leo: Meaning â€œlion-heartedâ€. ğŸ¦

Isaac: A sweet middle name meaning â€œone who laughsâ€.

Nuno: A Portuguese name meaning either â€œgrandfatherâ€ from the Latin nunnus or â€œninthâ€ from the Latin nonus. We love it as an adorable homage to a favorite grandfather.

Pim: A cute Dutch variation of William meaning â€œresolute protectionâ€.

Teo: An adorable short form of Theodore meaning â€œgift from Godâ€.

Cam: Meaning â€œcrooked noseâ€, there is something quite endearing about this little name.

Felix: Meaning â€œfortunateâ€.

Herb: A short form of Herbert meaning â€œbright rulerâ€.

Whatâ€™s a good middle name for a girl?

With boys taken care of, letâ€™s move on to some great girl middle names.

Remember, though: whatever the gender, if the name feels right, itâ€™s right.

Letâ€™s start with the most common middle names for girls:

First names that make good middle names for girls

Just as with boys, one of the best places to look for cool middle names for girls is among first names.

Here are some of the most popular:

Addison: Meaning â€œson of Adamâ€.

Amy: From the Latin word amare, Amy means â€œbelovedâ€. â¤ï¸

Beth: As a short form of Bethany, Beth means â€œhouse of figsâ€.

Olivia: Meaning â€œpeaceâ€.

Christina: Meaning â€œa follower of Christâ€.

Emma: A German baby girlâ€™s name meaning â€œwholeâ€ or â€œuniversalâ€.

Camille: Meaning â€œhelper to the priestâ€.

Sophia: A cute name meaning â€œwisdomâ€.

Isabella:: A beautiful Italian name meaning â€œdevoted to Godâ€.

Charlotte: This elegant French name means â€œfreeâ€.

Mia: Often associated with the Italian word mia meaning â€œmineâ€, Mia is also seen as a variation of the Slavic word mila, which means â€œbelovedâ€.

Harper: Meaning â€œharp playerâ€, this gender-neutral middle name could be the perfect homage for avid lovers of To Kill a Mockingbird.

Abigail: Meaning â€œmy fatherâ€™s joyâ€.

Emily: Meaning â€œrivalâ€. Thatâ€™s one way to inspire healthy competition.

Ella: Meaning â€œyoung girlâ€.

Camila: A Portuguese name meaning â€œpriestâ€™s helperâ€.

Luna: Meaning â€œmoonâ€.

Sofia: A French variation of Sophia meaning â€œwisdomâ€. ğŸ¦‰

Mila: Rooted in the Spanish word Milagros meaning â€œmiraclesâ€.

Aria: Literally meaning â€œairâ€, this Italian middle name refers to the self-contained solo vocal piece sung in operas. It also means â€œlionessâ€. Fearlessness takes many forms!

What are girl middle names from around the world?

For a more international-sounding name â€“ perhaps one that pays homage to your roots or that simply sounds lovely â€“ you could try:

Francesca: A popular Italian name meaning â€œfreeâ€.

Martina: Rooted in Roman mythology, this Latin name means â€œwarlikeâ€.

Eva: A melodic variation of the Hebrew Eve meaning â€œlifeâ€.

Sara: A chic form of the well-known Sarah meaning â€œprincess](https://www.peanut-app.io/blog/princess-baby-names)â€.

Anja: This unique Russian name comes from the Hebrew Hannah and means â€œGod has favored meâ€.

Fernanda: An invigorating Spanish middle name meaning â€œadventurousâ€ or â€œbold journeyâ€ that will have baby eager to get moving! ğŸ§­

Luda: This adorable Russian name means â€œlove of the peopleâ€.

Akari: A [Japanese](https://www.peanut-app.io/blog/japanese-baby-names middle name meaning â€œbrightâ€.

Mette: Norse in origin, Mette is a unique middle name that means â€œpearlâ€.

Terese: Meaning â€œharvesterâ€, Terese is a subtle way of attracting abundance babyâ€™s way.

Mariam: A variation of Miriam meaning â€œdrop of the seaâ€.

Basma: Arabic in origin, Basma means â€œsmileâ€.

Asha: Another positive Arabic middle name meaning â€œalive and wellâ€.

Can you have a surname as a middle name?

You can always mix it up a little by trying a last name as a middle name.

Itâ€™s common for families to give their child the motherâ€™s maiden name as a middle name (if youâ€™re not going double-barreled) â€“ and this can be a great way to honor both of your families.

Here are some last names that make awesome, unique middle names for boys and girls:

Anderson: Meaning â€œson of Andrewâ€.

Ashton: Meaning â€œash tree townâ€.

Beckett: Meaning â€œbeehiveâ€, Beckett is a firm favorite for literature lovers.

Bond: A British name so smooth, you may be surprised to learn it means â€œfarmerâ€.

Brook: A water name meaning â€œstreamâ€.

Cooper: Meaning â€œbarrel makerâ€.

Davis: Meaning â€œson of Davidâ€.

Ford: An encouraging name meaning â€œriver crossingâ€.

Harvey: Meaning â€œbattle worthyâ€.

Huxley: A nature name meaning â€œHughâ€™s meadowâ€.

Jarvis: Meaning â€œservant spearâ€.

Keegan: From the Irish clan name Mac AodhagÃ¡in meaning â€œlittle flameâ€.

Lennox: Meaning â€œelm groveâ€.

Morgan: A nautical name meaning â€œsea-bornâ€ or â€œsea-songâ€.

Percy: One of the sharper boy middle names meaning â€œone who pierces the valleyâ€.

Quinn: A gender-neutral Gaelic name meaning â€œdescendant of Connâ€ or â€œchiefâ€.

Riley: There is no shortage of inspo among Irish surnames. From the Gaelic raghalach, Riley means â€œvaliantâ€ or â€œcourageousâ€ and makes an equally appealing gender-neutral first name.

Sawyer: Another gender-neutral name, Sawyer means â€œwoodcutterâ€.

Sullivan: Rooted in the Irish word sÃºildhubhÃ¡n, meaning â€œdark eyesâ€. Broodyâ€¦

Watkins: Meaning â€œlittle Walterâ€. Achingly cute name to honor a beloved Walter in the family.

What are some cool middle names?

Want your little one to stand out from the crowd and set the trends?

How about these cool middles names:

What are cool middle names for girls?

From rare gems to warrior titles, these girl middle names are effortlessly cool:

Amelia: A beautiful name with a gritty soul meaning â€œindustriousnessâ€.

`space

Amber: Meaning â€œjewelâ€. ğŸ’

Avery: An elvish name with the badass meaning â€œruler of the elvesâ€.

Blaire: From the Gaelic word blÃ¡r, meaning â€œbattlefieldâ€.

Blake: Meaning â€œdarkâ€.

Blythe: Meaning â€œcheerfulâ€.

Britt: A Scandinavian name meaning â€œexalted oneâ€.

Cassandra: Meaning â€œthe one who shines and excels over manâ€. Qute the name for a modern woman!

Claire: From the Latin word clarus, meaning â€œbrightâ€.

Clarissa: Another name meaning â€œbrightâ€.

Clothilde: Meaning â€œfamous in battleâ€, how is this girlâ€™s middle name not cool!

Dawn: Meaning â€œdaybreakâ€.

Drew: Stemming from the Greek word andreios meaning â€œbraveâ€ or â€œcourageousâ€.

Eleanor: Meaning â€œshining lightâ€.

Imogen: From the Celtic name. Innogen meaning â€œmaidenâ€.

Ingrid: Inspired by the Norse god of fertility, Yngvi, Ingrid means â€œbeautifulâ€.

Jess: Meaning â€œgift of Godâ€.

Jill: Meaning â€œyouthfulâ€.

Jordana: Meaning â€œdown flowingâ€.

June: Inspired by the Roman goddess Juno â€“ the protector of childbirth and marriage â€“ June means â€œyouthfulâ€. So much more than a summer baby name.

Laura: Meaning â€œvictoryâ€.

Lillian: Meaning â€œlilyâ€.

Megan: Meaning â€œpearlâ€.

Meredith: Meaning â€œgreat rulerâ€.

Michelle: Meaning â€œwho resembles Godâ€..

Nell: Meaning â€œbright, shining oneâ€.

Paloma: From the Latin word palumbus meaning â€œdoveâ€.

Ruth: Meaning â€œcompassionate friendâ€.

Sabrina: Meaning â€œfrom the name of River Severnâ€.

Susanna: From the Egyptian word shoshen meaning â€œlotus flowerâ€.

Tabitha: Inspired by the Aramaic word for â€œgazelleâ€, Tabitha means â€œgraceâ€.

Tatiana: This Shakespearean-inspired name means â€œqueen of the fairiesâ€ known best for A Midsummer Nightâ€™s Dream.

Ursula: A cute girlâ€™s middle name meaning â€œlittle she-bearâ€.

What are cool boy middle names?

Give your little guy the edge with these cool middle names for boys:

Charles: Inspire free thinking with these dignified middle name meaning â€œfree manâ€.

Egil: A very cool Viking-style middle name for boys meaning â€œaweâ€ or â€œterrorâ€.

Dean: May mean â€œvalleyâ€ but Dean is forever associated with *Rebel Without a Causeâ€.

Wyatt: A feisty boyâ€™s middle name meaning â€œbrave in warâ€.

Flynn: Meaning â€œson of Flannâ€ or â€œred complexionâ€.

Grey: Meaning â€œgrey-hairedâ€.

`spacer

Chance: Meaning â€œgood fortuneâ€. ğŸ¥ 

King: If you want to set baby up for greatness why not give them the middle name of a â€œkingâ€. ğŸ‘‘

Mark: Meaning â€œwar-likeâ€.

Rhys: Meaning â€œpassionateâ€ or â€œardentâ€.

Shea: Meaning â€œthe stately, dauntless oneâ€. Impressive.

Leonardo: A handsome middle name for boys meaning â€œlion-heartedâ€.

Lucas: Meaning â€œbringer of lightâ€.

Casey: From the Gaelic cathasaigh meaning â€œwatchfulâ€.

Ryder: A gender-neutral middle name meaning â€œhorsemanâ€.

Oscar: A ultra cool Irish middle name for boys meaning â€œspear of the Godsâ€.

Xavier: Meaning â€œhouseâ€, the temptation to use this as the middle name to Charles is real.

Wilder: Baby born to be wild? Meaning â€œuntamedâ€, Wilder is an easy pick for your inhibited child.

Max: Meaning â€œthe greatestâ€.

Nico: A hip Italian take on the Greek Nicholas meaning â€œvictory of the peopleâ€.

Lloyd: From the Welsh word * llwyd* meaning â€œgrey-hairedâ€.

Seth: Meaning â€œappointedâ€.

Claude: A grounding middle name meaning â€œstrong-willedâ€.

George: Meaning â€œearth workerâ€.

Francis: Meaning â€œfree manâ€.

Lawrence: Meaning â€œbright oneâ€.

Nolan: Sharing the name of the director behind The Dark Knight has to be pretty cool right? What if we told you the name means â€œchampionâ€?

What are the top middle names?

If youâ€™re keen to know what the most popular middle names are, here are the top 10 for boys and girls:

What are popular middle names for boys?

According to a recent UK survey, the most popular boy middle names are still the classics:

James: Meaning â€œsupplanterâ€.

John: Meaning â€œGod is graciousâ€.

William: Meaning â€œresolute protectorâ€.

Thomas: From the Hebrew word for â€œtwinâ€, taâ€™om.

David: Meaning â€œbelovedâ€.

Robert: Meaning â€œbright fameâ€.

Edward: Meaning â€œwealthy guardâ€.

Peter: Meaning â€œrockâ€.

Lee: Meaning â€œmeadowâ€.

Christopher: Meaning â€œchrist-bearerâ€.

Alexander: Meaning â€œdefender of menâ€.

Michael: Meaning â€œwho is like Godâ€.

Daniel: Meaning â€œGod is my judgeâ€.

In the US, the top 10 is pretty similar, with the addition of:

Anthony: Show show irreplaceable baby is with this enduring middle name meaning â€œpriceless oneâ€.

Allen: Meaning â€œhandsomeâ€ and â€œcheerfulâ€.

Joseph: Meaning â€œGod will giveâ€.

What are popular girl middle names?

In the UK, the top girl middle names are:

Louise: Meaning â€œrenowned warriorâ€.

Rose: A favorite flower name meaning â€œroseâ€.

Grace: From the Latin word gratia, meaning â€œgraceâ€.

Jane: Meaning â€œGod is graciousâ€.

Elizabeth: Meaning â€œGod is my oathâ€.

Anne/Ann: Meaning â€œgraceâ€.

May/Mae: Inspired by the Roman fertility goddess Maia.

Marie: Meaning â€œstar of the seaâ€.

Mary: Meaning â€œbelovedâ€ or â€œdrop of the seaâ€.

Amy: A sweet name from the Latin amare meaning â€œbelovedâ€.

Catherine: Meaning â€œpureâ€.

Kate: Also meaning â€œpureâ€.

Victoria: A Victorian name meaning â€œvictoryâ€.

And in the US theyâ€™re pretty similar, but with three different middle names making a top 10 appearance:

Faith: A virtue name that wears its heart on its sleeve. Also means â€œtrustâ€ and â€œdevotionâ€.

Lynn: Sometimes used as a nickname for Linda meaning â€œbeautifulâ€. Lynn is best known as a Celtic name for a â€œlakeâ€, â€œpoolâ€, or â€œwaterfallâ€.

Renee: Meaning â€œborn againâ€.

What is a rare middle name?

Looking for middle names that no-one else will have?

Your best bet is to seek out the baby names that are uncommon and [unique}(https://www.peanut-app.io/blog/cool-baby-names).

To get you started on your quest for good middle names that have stayed off the radar, weâ€™ve gathered a few of our favorites:

Atlas: Meaning â€œbearer of the heavensâ€, Atlas is steeped in Greek mythology. Instead of carrying the world on their shoulders, this middle name may inspire baby to leave their stamp on it. ğŸ—ºï¸

Adeline: Going for vintage is always a good move if you want something rare. Meaning â€œnobleâ€, we think Adeline is a great middle name for a little lady.

Titus: Meaning â€œof the giantsâ€ this is not a name for the faint of heart.

Amory: Meaning â€œhome rulerâ€, this gender-neutral middle name flows off the tongue.

Ari: This gender-neutral name may be gaining popularity thanks to the esteemed horror director Ari Aster, but we love its meaning of â€œlionâ€ or â€œeagleâ€.

Poet: If you live and breath poetry, why not share the passion? This middle name literally means â€œone who writes verseâ€.

Griffin: A vintage middle name for boys, Griffin means â€œstrong lordâ€. ğŸ’ª

What are weird middle names?

Looking for truly unique middle names?

You could do what a few of our Peanut mamas have done, and choose your pregnancy craving for babyâ€™s middle name, like:

Pickle: A pregnancy craving classic.

Ben: After Ben & Jerryâ€™s ice cream. Also means â€œsonâ€, making it a solid middle name for boys.

Jerry: The other half of the ice cream dynasty, Jerry means â€œspearâ€.

Peanut: Of course we love this one, but itâ€™s also super-cute if youâ€™ve been craving peanut butter. ğŸ¥œ

Hershey: If youâ€™ve been craving chocolate, this could be the perfect baby middle name!

Pepper: If youâ€™ve been feeling spicy during pregnancy, youâ€™ll love this baby middle name. ğŸŒ¶ï¸

Apple: If it works as a baby name for Gwyneth, then it could work just as well as a middle name!

Honey: Feeling sweet?

Muffin: Kinda cute, right?

What are beautiful middle names?

Want to complement babyâ€™s gorgeous first name?

Any of these beautiful middle names is sure to do babyâ€™s title justice:

Anastasia: From the Greek word anastasis meaning â€œressurectionâ€, Anastasis is both beautiful and badass.

Belle: A favorite of many a Disney princess fan, Belle means â€œbeautifulâ€.

Evelyn: If youâ€™ve been hoping for a little girl, celebrate her arrival with this pretty middle name meaning â€œwished forâ€.

Tristan: From the Celtic legend Tristan and Isolde, this mythical name means â€œsorrowfulâ€.

39 Cosmo: Thereâ€™s something very celestial about this old Italian name. Meaning â€œdecencyâ€ and â€œbeautyâ€, itâ€™s rich with inspiration.

Ava: Meaning â€œbirdikeâ€, Ava will add a soulful melody to any girlâ€™s name. ğŸ¶

Paige: Meaning â€œyoung helperâ€.

Willow: One of the more elegant tree baby names meaning â€œwillow treeâ€.

What are short middle names?

Keep it short and sweet with these svelt middle names for boys and girls:

Bree: A simple sound with big ideas, Bree means â€œexalted oneâ€.

Bea: Meaning â€œbringer of joyâ€. Short for Beatrice. Resist the urge to nickname baby â€˜honeyâ€™.

Hope: An elegant Puritan name that fits beautifully as a middle name.

Ray: Meaning â€œwise protectorâ€.

Pam: A sweet middle name meaning â€œhoneyâ€.

Kai: In MÄori, Kai means â€œfoodâ€ or mealâ€. In Japanese, Kai also means â€œshellâ€ or â€œoceanâ€.

Reed: Meaning â€œred hairâ€.

Elle: Deeply connected with the French word elle meaning â€œsheâ€. Could also be a short form of Eleanor, which means â€œshining lightâ€.

Jax: A hip, too-cool-for-school variation of Jackson meaning â€œson of Jackâ€.

Jude: Fans of The Beatles will love this middle name meaning â€œpraisedâ€.

Rae: Rooted in the Hebrew name Rachel meaning â€œeweâ€. ğŸ‘

What is the best middle name?

Ultimately, the best middle name will be up to you.

Itâ€™ll sound good, it could reflect your family, and it will just feel right.

Inspiration can come from the most surprising of places, including our Peanut community.

The perfect middle nameâ€™s out there, mama!
